messages.message: Does anyone know how the `cypress` snapshot is managed? Looking to update it with the same changes mentioned above. cc @Paul H it looks like you created it originally

To update the snapshot, according to my notes:
• You can create a sandbox based on the snapshot-update (https://instabase.sandboxes.site/templates/snapshot-update) template
• Access that terminal via web terminal or `cs ssh`, then `cd /home/owner/instabase/third-party/crafting/snapshot`
• Run `make build-image-cypress`
• Run `cs snapshot create cypress`
    ◦ This will overwrite the current snapshot. You can use a dummy name to test it if you want
• Delete the `snapshot-update` sandbox
The `cypress` snapshot is basically the same as the `instabase-dev` snapshot. The difference is how we spin up `webpack`, where the `bin/webpack` script checks for a `IS_CYPRESS` flag (but this shouldn’t be relevant to what you’re doing)
Ah it looks like the snapshot directory was removed bc we no longer use ansible
I should be able to build a new image by just disabling the dockerfiles for tools that aren’t needed in cypress
